alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:51PM EST until January 10 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey, including the following counties, Burlington, Camden, Gloucester and Mercer and southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bucks, Chester, Delaware, Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - For Pennypack Creek at Pennypack: At 8:41pm the stage was 7.44 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 7 feet. For Neshaminy Creek at Penns Park: At 8:30pm the stage was 14.14 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 13 feet. For Wissahickon Creek at Wissahickon: At 8:00pm the stage was 4.92 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 5 feet. For Valley Creek at Valley Forge: At 8:30pm the stage was 9.3 feet and rising. Flood Stage is 10 feet. For Wissahickon Creek at Fort Washington and rising: At 8:30pm the stage was 10.4 feet. Flood Stage is 10 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
